image.altText: A group including members of the National Socialist Network.

props.synopsis: Neo-Nazi leader refuses to sign his bail forms while 14 men were granted bail after their involvement in a far-right rally on the weekend.

title.children: Neo-Nazi refuses to sign bail forms as 14 others from Australia Day rally released

image.altText: Dr Megan Brooks - woman with black jacket and blue shirt and short hair walks out of coroners court

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest has heard that multiple attempts to escalate an emergency response were made after a ramping-related death in Adelaide, but staff were told the situation did not meet the criteria.

title.children: Hospital boss's attempt to escalate emergency response after ramping-related death denied, court hears

image.altText: A stethoscope on a white surface

props.synopsis: South Australian general practitioner Hemant Kumar Vanmali began an inappropriate relationship with a patient, who was aged in her 80s, "almost immediately" after her last consultation.

title.children: Doctor suspended over inappropriate relationship with elderly patient

image.altText: Shark carcass lies on the sand along the beach

props.synopsis: Research confirms a great white shark that washed up on a beach in south-west Victoria was the victim of killer whale predation.

title.children: Bite mark swabs show orcas killed 4.7m great white shark

image.altText: The tail of a Virgin Australia plane on the tarmac, with other planes lines up behind it.

props.synopsis: Virgin has confirmed it will "indefinitely suspend" its Darwin to Adelaide service, saying it will add more direct flights between the Top End and other capital cities.

title.children: 'Unbelievable': Virgin suspends flights between Darwin and Adelaide

image.altText: Dan Cregan speaks to the media.

props.synopsis: South Australian Police Minister Dan Cregan is quitting state cabinet, citing "pressing family matters", triggering a reshuffle ahead of his retirement from politics at the next election.

title.children: SA minister quits cabinet ahead of retirement from politics

image.altText: Big black cockie with white marking on tail, perched on gum tree branch, holding a feather

props.synopsis: The deadly Wangary bushfire 20 years ago appears to have been the final nail in the coffin for yellow-tailed black cockatoos in South Australia's Eyre Peninsula. Ecologists are calling for urgent action before it's too late.

title.children: Help needed to save the last cockatoos restricted to this region

image.altText: A man wearing black rimmed glasses, black suit and yellow tie stands in front of a group of media microphones speaking.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says "there is no place for this hateful ideology here in Australia" following the arrest of 16 National Socialist Network members on Sunday.

title.children: PM condemns 'horrific scenes' of neo-Nazi gathering in Adelaide

image.altText: Asian-looking smiling man, light suit, and woman, short hair, dark suit, tie, earrings, sit in front of  haystack, arm in arm.

props.synopsis: Julie Mar says she has sometimes gone without buying groceries to fund her husband's partner visa. A solicitor says the application process can cost upwards of $9,000.

title.children: Partner visa expense and delay cause heartache for married couple

image.altText: aerial shot of Adelaide's water desalination plant

props.synopsis: Desalination production south of Adelaide is set to quadruple as local reservoirs fall to 44 per cent capacity, with dry conditions causing the lowest inflows in over 40 years.

title.children: Desalination plant to 'ramp up' as reservoir levels drop to 20-year low

image.altText: A beached beaked whale near a river

props.synopsis: A wildlife ranger says the discovery of a beached whale, believed to be a beaked whale, on South Australia's Kangaroo Island is a "peculiar" occurrence.

title.children: 'Elusive deep-water' whale found beached on Kangaroo Island

image.altText: An SA Police vehicle with flashing lights.

props.synopsis: A 20-year-old woman is airlifted to hospital after she was struck by a boat allegedly being operated by a woman with a blood alcohol concentration nearly three times the legal limit.

title.children: Swimmer airlifted to hospital after being struck by boat on River Murray

image.altText: Julianne Hancock stands wearing brown sunglasses, a blue and green shirt and white pants in front of the Murray River.

props.synopsis: A shortage of qualified instructors has made adult swimming lessons harder to find despite a rise in drownings.

title.children: Town offers adult swimming lessons to reduce drowning rate

image.altText: A variety of rubbish, including a swing set, dumped on a brown forest floor, with green trees behind

props.synopsis: Forestry companies say a rise in rubbish dumping increases fire hazards in an already high-risk summer, and it is costing them thousands of dollars to clean up.

title.children: Lack of education blamed for rubbish being dumped in forests

image.altText: An elephant inside a cage with a zookeeper standing outside

props.synopsis: Perth Zoo's last remaining female elephant, Permai, is on the road to her forever home at South Australia's Monarto Safari Park.

title.children: Sadness as 'unique' Perth Zoo elephant leaves for new life in South Australia

image.altText: A corrugated rain tank on a stand near a windmill with the bush and grass illuminated red by a fire at night.

props.synopsis: An accommodation and wedding venue and up to two homes in Victoria's west have been destroyed by a bushfire that has burnt through 65,000 hectares of land.

title.children: Lodge and up to two homes destroyed by bushfire in Victoria's west

image.altText: Blue sky with wisps of cloud behind the Nvidia logo on the company's Santa Clara HQ.

props.synopsis: Even if you don't pay much attention to the stock market, chances are you've heard about Nvidia and its share price today. Catch up on why it matters.

title.children: Nvidia stock prices have crashed. Here's what the company does

image.altText: Hands holding a jar of pills.

props.synopsis: Pressure is mounting on Australia's medicines regulator to tighten restrictions around vitamin B6 supplements, with more cases of people inadvertently poisoning themselves emerging.

title.children: The synthetic vitamin leaving several Australians with major health issues

image.altText: Yvonne Engelman, who survived the horrors of Auschwitz, looks into the camera at her home in Sydney

props.synopsis: Yvonne Engelman, who survived the horrors of the Nazi concentration camp Auschwitz, recalls her experiences as the world marks the 80th anniversary of liberation.

title.children: Australian survived Auschwitz when gas chamber 'didn't work'

image.altText: Mother charged infant

props.synopsis: The 34-year-old, who cannot be named to protect the identity of the child, appeared in the Brisbane Magistrates Court on Tuesday, where she made an application for bail.

title.children: Influencer accused of drugging baby daughter with anticonvulsant medication

image.altText: A screenshot of a video posted to social media showing the aftermath of the explosion.

props.synopsis: An explosion at a food market visited just days earlier by the Chinese president has resulted in an unknown number of casualties.

title.children: Chinese censors suppress details of explosion at market visited by Xi Jinping

image.altText: A black and white photo of a young white woman with dark curly hair wearing a white collared shirt.

props.synopsis: Daniel Browning, host of The Art Show and Arts in 30, pays homage to respected former ABC Radio National presenter Julie Copeland.

title.children: Vale Julie Copeland, an 'intrepid' and pioneering arts broadcaster

image.altText: Mark Zuckerberg, Jeff Bezos, Sundar Pichai and Elon Musk standing on a stage

props.synopsis: While all the focus during US President Donald Trump's inauguration was on tariffs, the sight of four tech titans at the ceremony should have put another economic policy on the radar: Tax.

title.children: Trump's powerful new allies don't much like Australia

image.altText: woman holding child and talking on phone while using laptop

props.synopsis: Chronic connectivity and inequity in the home are partly to blame for why two-thirds of women say they feel unable to switch off from work.

title.children: Why women find it hard to switch off from work

image.altText: Sam Konstas of Australia fields during an Australia nets session, throwing the cricket ball

props.synopsis: Travis Head will open the batting for Australia in the first Test against Sri Lanka in Galle, leaving Sam Konstas in a battle for a middle order position to save his spot in the side.

title.children: Head to open in first Sri Lanka Test, Konstas at risk of being dropped

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A man wears a mask, blue jumper and business shirt as he leaves court

props.synopsis: A Perth financial advisor pleads guilty to stealing more than $1 million from his clients' superannuation funds, with one couple losing $500,000 of their retirement nest egg.

title.children: Financial advisor admits stealing $1 million from clients' superannuation funds

image.altText: Donald Trump and Benjamin Netanyahu shake hands.

props.synopsis: As Donald Trump reshapes America's relationship with Israel — from appointing right wing candidates as ambassadors to Israel and the UN and overturning sanctions on violent Jewish settlers — can the two-state solution survive?

title.children: The battle for a two-state solution just got a whole lot harder

image.altText: An illustration of a finger tapping on a phone screen with a large padlock being shown on it.

props.synopsis: The ABC analysed 29 million stolen codes to help you avoid using an insecure one.

title.children: We looked at millions of stolen PINs and found the absolute worst one

image.altText: Photo illustration of NSW Police officer in silhouette and hands on phone to the left

props.synopsis: A complaint against a NSW Police sergeant was over an incident that allegedly took place during a long drive when he refused to stop the car to allow another officer to use the bathroom.

title.children: Outrage at NSW Police response to complaint against sergeant

image.altText: a man talking

props.synopsis: Health Minister Tim Nicholls unveiled the pause on Tuesday as he also announced a review into the evidence for stage one and two hormone therapies for children with gender dysphoria.

title.children: Queensland government halts hormone treatment for new trans patients under 18

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton stand next to each other.

props.synopsis: Australians could head to the polls in a federal election within months. So when will it be and what are the key seats in the battle to lead the country?

title.children: The states that will decide the next federal election

image.altText: a woman smiles for the camera arm-in-arm with a girl whose face is blurred out

props.synopsis: A teenage boy who was a passenger in a car allegedly stolen after the fatal stabbing of Vyleen White has been sentenced to four months' probation.

title.children: Teen passenger in 70yo stabbing victim's allegedly stolen car given probation

image.altText: A smiling young woman with a gold medal around her neck holds the Australian flag as she stands on a podium.

props.synopsis: Peta Bradley had been training in scorching temperatures before she left to compete in Italy, but that didn't stop her from claiming gold.

title.children: Country athlete who trained in muddy dam becomes ice swimming world champ
